School Projects

Code Is Available Upon Request!

Mock J Shell

In a group of 4, we created a file system and command prompt using Java for our Software Design Class. We planned our design using CRC Cards labelling each of the responsibilities and dependencies. We also used extensive error checking and unittesting using Junit. Here are the principles we used: Scrum Meetings, Abstract Classes and Methods, Singleton Design Pattern, Single Responsibility Principle, Generics, Mock Objects

Scrum: held weekly scrum meetings to outline tasks for everyone to do

Abstract Classes/Methods: allowed us to better organize code

SRP: minimized responisbilities of each class, allowing for better modularity.

Singleton: this design pattern allows multiple JShell windows to correspond to one instance of a file system.

Mock Objects: these helped with unittesting. In order to test our classes, we didn't need to have the actual class done to test it.

Buxfer

A service that lets groups of people track shared expenses. It records the person who paid the expensive and its cost. Allows group members to examine amount individuals have paid, look at history of all transactions, or determine group member that is owing the most. Inspired by Buxfer.

Linked Lists: Group objects stores it's users and transactions in linked lists, allowing for easy traversal, additon and deletion.

Memory Allocation: had to ensure the instantiated object used no more than the required memory and that deleted objects were deleted from memory. (Garbage Collection)
